summary.span: 表示数据在内存中的缓存。

span.span: Represents an in-memory cache of data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ，这是从数据源检索数据的内存中缓存是 ADO.NET 体系结构的主要组件。The , which is an in-memory cache of data retrieved from a data source, is a major component of the ADO.NET architecture. 包含的集合对象，您可以互相关联起来与对象。The consists of a collection of objects that you can relate to each other with objects. 此外可以强制实施中的数据完整性通过使用和对象。You can also enforce data integrity in the by using the and objects. 有关使用更多细节对象，请参阅[数据集、 数据表和数据视图](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/index.md)。For further details about working with objects, see [DataSets, DataTables, and DataViews](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/index.md). 而对象包含的数据， ，您可以通过导航层次结构一个表。Whereas objects contain the data, the allows you to navigate though the table hierarchy. 这些表包含在通过访问属性。The tables are contained in a accessed through the property. 访问时对象，请注意，它们是有条件地区分大小写。When accessing objects, note that they are conditionally case sensitive. 例如，如果一个名为"mydatatable"和另一个名为"Mydatatable"，用来搜索一个表的字符串将被视为区分大小写。For example, if one is named "mydatatable" and another is named "Mydatatable", a string used to search for one of the tables is regarded as case sensitive. 但是，如果存在"mydatatable"，"Mydatatable"不被件，不区分大小写的搜索字符串。However, if "mydatatable" exists and "Mydatatable" does not, the search string is regarded as case insensitive. 有关使用详细信息对象，请参阅[创建数据表](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/creating-a-datatable.md)。For more information about working with objects, see [Creating a DataTable](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/dataset-datatable-dataview/creating-a-datatable.md). 一个可以读取和写入数据和架构为 XML 文档。A can read and write data and schema as XML documents. 数据和架构可通过 HTTP 传输和任何应用程序，支持 XML 的任何平台上使用。The data and schema can then be transported across HTTP and used by any application, on any platform that is XML-enabled. 您可以将架构作为 XML 架构与方法，、 架构和数据可以保存使用方法。You can save the schema as an XML schema with the method, and both schema and data can be saved using the method. 若要读取包含架构和数据的 XML 文档，使用方法。To read an XML document that includes both schema and data, use the method. 在典型的多层实现，用于创建和刷新的步骤，，并依次更新原始数据：In a typical multiple-tier implementation, the steps for creating and refreshing a , and in turn, updating the original data are to: 1. 生成并填充每个中中的数据源使用的数据。Build and fill each in a with data from a data source using a . 2. 更改个人中的数据通过添加、 更新或删除对象对象。Change the data in individual objects by adding, updating, or deleting objects. 3. 调用方法以创建另一个功能仅对数据的更改。Invoke the method to create a second that features only the changes to the data. 4. 调用方法，将传递第二个作为自变量。Call the method of the , passing the second as an argument. 5. 调用方法将从第二个更改合并到第一个。Invoke the method to merge the changes from the second into the first. 6. 调用上。Invoke the on the . 或者，调用取消所做的更改。Alternatively, invoke to cancel the changes. > [!NOTE] > 并对象继承自，并支持远程处理的接口。The and objects inherit from , and support the interface for remoting. 这两个对象是唯一可远程处理的 ADO.NET 对象。These are the only ADO.NET objects that can be remoted. > [!NOTE] > 类继承自不会被终结由垃圾回收器，因为已取消在终结器。Classes inherited from are not finalized by the garbage collector, because the finalizer has been suppressed in . 在派生的类可以调用其构造函数，以允许通过垃圾回收器来完成的类中的方法。The derived class can call the method in its constructor to allow the class to be finalized by the garbage collector. ## Examples 下面的示例包含的几种方法的组合，创建并填充从**Northwind**数据库。The following example consists of several methods that, combined, create and fill a from the **Northwind** database. [!code-csharp[Classic WebData DataSet Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataSet Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData DataSet Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataSet Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

summary.span: 提交自加载此 或上次调用 以来对其进行的所有更改。

span.span: Commits all the changes made to this since it was loaded or since the last time was called.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 同时并类具有方法。Both the and classes have methods. 调用处级别的原因方法为每个调用。Calling at the level causes the method for each to be called. 同样，调用上会导致对每个表内调用。Similarly, invoking on the causes to be called on each table within the . 在这种方式，您可以从该处可以调用该方法的多个级别。In this manner, you have multiple levels at which the method can be invoked. 调用的使您能调用上的所有从属对象 （例如，表和行） 与一个调用的方法。Calling the of the enables you to invoke the method on all subordinate objects (for example, tables and rows) with one call. 当您调用`AcceptChanges`上`DataSet`，则所有仍处于编辑模式的对象已成功结束其编辑。When you call `AcceptChanges` on the `DataSet`, any objects still in edit-mode end their edits successfully. 每个属性也会更改;`Added`并`Modified`行变得`Unchanged`，和`Deleted`删除行。The property of each also changes; `Added` and `Modified` rows become `Unchanged`, and `Deleted` rows are removed. 如果`DataSet`包含对象，则调用`AcceptChanges`方法还会导致强制执行。If the `DataSet` contains objects, invoking the `AcceptChanges` method also causes the to be enforced. > [!NOTE] > `AcceptChanges` 并`RejectChanges`仅适用于`DataRow`相关更改 （即，添加、 删除、 删除和修改）。`AcceptChanges` and `RejectChanges` only apply to `DataRow` related changes (that is, Add, Remove, Delete, and Modify). 它们不是适用于架构或结构上的更改。They are not applicable to schema or structural changes. > > 如果已使用 DataAdapter 填充 DataSet，则调用 AcceptChange 不会将这些更改复制回数据源中。Calling AcceptChanges will not replicate these changes back to the data source if the DataSet was filled using a DataAdapter. 在此情况下，请改为调用 。In that situation, call instead. 请参阅[使用 Dataadapter 更新数据源](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/33y2221y.aspx)有关详细信息。See [Updating Data Sources with DataAdapters](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/33y2221y.aspx) for more information. ## Examples 以下示例将添加到中。The following example adds a to a in a . 然后在调用方法，所有的级联它所包含的对象。The method is then called on the , which cascades to all objects that it contains. [!code-csharp[Classic WebData DataSet.AcceptChanges#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataSet.AcceptChanges/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData DataSet.AcceptChanges#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataSet.AcceptChanges/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 创建一个新，其中包含一份原始中的所有行具有挂起的更改。Creates a new that contains a copy of all rows in the original that have pending changes. 关系约束可能会导致其他未更改的行添加到新如果未更改的行包含对应于已更改的行中的外键的主键。Relationship constraints can cause additional unchanged rows to be added to the new if the unchanged rows contain primary keys corresponding to foreign keys in the changed rows. 该方法返回`null`如果在最初没有任何行具有挂起的更改。The method returns `null` if there are no rows in the original that have pending changes. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个简单使用一个表、 两个列和 10 行。The following example creates a simple with one table, two columns, and ten rows. 更改两个值，且添加了一个行。Two values are changed, and one row is added. 使用创建的已更改的数据子集方法。A subset of the changed data is created using the method. 消除错误之后，新列添加到更改的架构的子集。After reconciling errors, a new column is added to the subset, changing the schema. 当与调用方法`missingSchemaAction`设置为`MissingSchemaAction.Add`，将新列添加到原始对象的架构。When the method is called with the `missingSchemaAction` set to `MissingSchemaAction.Add`, the new column is added to the original object's schema. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法提供了一种技术填充单个从检索的数据与实例。The method provides a technique for filling a single with data, retrieved from an instance. 此方法提供相同的功能，但允许您从多个结果集加载`IDataReader`成多个表内`DataSet`。This method provides the same functionality, but allows you to load multiple result sets from an `IDataReader` into multiple tables within a `DataSet`. 如果 `DataSet` 已经包含行，则从数据源传入的数据与现有行合并。If the `DataSet` already contains rows, the incoming data from the data source is merged with the existing rows. `Load`方法可在几个常见方案，都围绕着从指定的数据源获取数据并将其添加到当前的数据容器 (在这种情况下， `DataSet`)。The `Load` method can be used in several common scenarios, all centered around getting data from a specified data source and adding it to the current data container (in this case, a `DataSet`). 以下方案说明的标准用法`DataSet`、 描述其更新和合并行为。These scenarios describe standard usage for a `DataSet`, describing its update and merge behavior. 一个`DataSet`同步或更新与单个主数据源。A `DataSet` synchronizes or updates with a single primary data source. `DataSet`跟踪更改，以实现与主数据源同步。The `DataSet` tracks changes, allowing synchronization with the primary data source. 此外，`DataSet`可以接受来自一个或多个辅助数据源的增量数据。In addition, a `DataSet` can accept incremental data from one or more secondary data sources. `DataSet`不负责跟踪更改，以允许与辅助数据源同步。The `DataSet` isn't responsible for tracking changes in order to allow synchronization with the secondary data source. 给定这些两个假设数据源，用户很可能需要以下行为之一：Given these two hypothetical data sources, a user is likely to require one of the following behaviors: - 初始化`DataSet`从主数据源。Initialize `DataSet` from a primary data source. 在此方案中，用户想要初始化一个空`DataSet`使用主数据源中的值。In this scenario, the user wants to initialize an empty `DataSet` with values from the primary data source. 一个或多个 DataTable 的内容被修改。One or more DataTable's contents are modified. 更高版本用户想要将更改传播回主数据源。Later the user intends to propagate changes back to the primary data source. - 保留更改，并从主数据源重新同步。Preserve changes and re-synchronize from the primary data source. 在此方案中，用户想要采取`DataSet`填充在前面的方案和执行增量同步使用的主数据源，保留中所做的修改`DataSet`。In this scenario, the user wants to take the `DataSet` filled in the previous scenario and perform an incremental synchronization with the primary data source, preserving modifications made in the `DataSet`. - 增量数据馈送从辅助数据源。Incremental data feed from secondary data sources. 在此方案中，用户要合并来自一个或多个辅助数据源的更改并将这些更改传回的主数据源。In this scenario, the user wants to merge changes from one or more secondary data sources, and propagate those changes back to the primary data source. `Load`方法使所有这些方案成为可能。The `Load` method makes all these scenarios possible. 此方法可以指定负载选项参数，该值指示如何中的现有行结合正在加载的行。This method allows you to specify a load option parameter, indicating how rows already in a combine with rows being loaded. 下表描述了所提供的三个加载选项枚举。The following table describes the three load options provided by the enumeration. 每种情况下，描述传入数据中的行的主键匹配的现有行的主键时指示的行为。In each case, the description indicates the behavior when the primary key of a row in the incoming data matches the primary key of an existing row. |加载选项Load Option|描述Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`PreserveChanges`（默认值）`PreserveChanges` (default)|使用的传入行的值更新行的原始版本。Updates the original version of the row with the value of the incoming row.| |`OverwriteChanges`|使用的传入行的值更新行的当前和原始版本。Updates the current and original versions of the row with the value of the incoming row.| |`Upsert`|使用的传入行的值更新行的当前版本。Updates the current version of the row with the value of the incoming row.| 一般情况下，`PreserveChanges`并`OverwriteChanges`选项适用于方案需要用来同步用户`DataSet`及其更改与主数据源。In general, the `PreserveChanges` and `OverwriteChanges` options are intended for scenarios in which the user needs to synchronize the `DataSet` and its changes with the primary data source. `Upsert`选项可从一个或多个辅助数据源的聚合更改。The `Upsert` option facilitates aggregating changes from one or more secondary data sources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法提供了一种技术填充单个从检索的数据与实例。The method provides a technique for filling a single with data, retrieved from an instance. 此方法提供相同的功能，但允许您从多个结果集加载成多个表内。This method provides the same functionality, but allows you to load multiple result sets from an into multiple tables within a . > [!NOTE] > 加载操作将因如果在传入的源数据列的任何`reader`是计算的列。The load operation will fail with an if any of the source data columns in the incoming `reader` are computed columns. `loadOption`参数，可指定要导入的数据与现有数据进行交互和可以是任何中的值的方式枚举。The `loadOption` parameter allows you to specify how you want the imported data to interact with existing data, and can be any of the values from the enumeration. 请参阅的文档有关使用此参数的详细信息的方法。See the documentation for the method for more information on using this parameter. `tables`参数允许您指定的数组实例，指示每个结果集加载从读取器所对应的表的顺序。The `tables` parameter allows you to specify an array of instances, indicating the order of the tables corresponding to each result set loaded from the reader. 方法填充每个提供单个结果集，从源数据读取器中的数据的实例。The method fills each supplied instance with data from a single result set from the source data reader. 在每个结果集之后,方法会移到下一步中的结果集读取器，直到没有更多结果集。After each result set, the method moves on to the next result set within the reader, until there are no more result sets. 此方法的名称解析方案是与跟相同方法的类。The name resolution scheme for this method is the same as that followed by the method of the class. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个新，添加两个到实例，然后填充使用方法，检索从数据，其中包含两个结果集。The following example creates a new , adds two instances to the , and then fills the using the method, retrieving data from a that contains two result sets. 最后，该示例在控制台窗口中显示的表的内容。Finally, the example displays the contents of the tables in the console window. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法提供了一种技术填充单个从检索的数据与实例。The method provides a technique for filling a single with data, retrieved from an instance. 此方法提供相同的功能，但允许您从多个结果集加载`IDataReader`成多个表内`DataSet`。This method provides the same functionality, but allows you to load multiple result sets from an `IDataReader` into multiple tables within a `DataSet`. > [!NOTE] > 加载操作将因如果在传入的源数据列的任何`reader`是计算的列。The load operation will fail with an if any of the source data columns in the incoming `reader` are computed columns. `loadOption`参数，可指定要导入的数据与现有数据进行交互和可以是任何中的值的方式枚举。The `loadOption` parameter allows you to specify how you want the imported data to interact with existing data, and can be any of the values from the enumeration. 请参阅的文档有关使用此参数的详细信息的方法。See the documentation for the method for more information on using this parameter. `tables`参数可以指定表名，指示每个结果集加载从读取器所对应的表的顺序的数组。The `tables` parameter allows you to specify an array of table names, indicating the order of the tables corresponding to each result set loaded from the reader. `Load`方法会尝试查找一个表中的`DataSet`找到匹配名称的表名称，按顺序的数组中。The `Load` method attempts to find a table within the `DataSet` matching the name found in the array of table names, in order. 如果找到匹配表，该表加载当前结果集的内容。If a matching table is found, that table is loaded with the content of the current result set. 如果不找到任何匹配的表，则使用提供的表名称的数组中的名称创建一个表并从结果集中推断新表的架构。If no matching table is found, a table is created using the name supplied in the array of table names, and the new table's schema is inferred from the result set. 在每个结果集之后,`Load`方法会移到下一步中的结果集读取器，直到没有更多结果集。After each result set, the `Load` method moves on to the next result set within the reader, until there are no more result sets. 关联的默认命名空间`DataSet`，如果有的话是关联与每个新创建的`DataTable`。The default namespace associated with `DataSet`, if any, is associated with each newly created `DataTable`. 此方法的名称解析方案是与跟相同方法的类。The name resolution scheme for this method is the same as that followed by the method of the class. ## Examples 以下控制台应用程序示例首先创建表，并将数据加载到一个读取器从，并使用`Load`方法。The following Console application example first creates tables and loads data from a reader into a , using the `Load` method. 然后，该示例添加到表，并尝试用中的数据填充表。The example then adds tables to a and attempts to fill the tables with data from a . 在此示例中，因为参数传递给`Load`方法指示不存在的表名称`Load`方法创建一个新表作为参数传递的名称匹配。In this example, because the parameters passed to the `Load` method indicate a table name that does not exist, the `Load` method creates a new table to match the name passed as a parameter. 加载数据后，示例在控制台窗口中显示所有表的内容。Once the data has been loaded, the example displays the contents of all its tables in the Console window. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法提供了一种技术填充单个从检索的数据与实例。The method provides a technique for filling a single with data, retrieved from an instance. 此方法提供相同的功能，但允许您从多个结果集加载成多个表内。This method provides the same functionality, but allows you to load multiple result sets from an into multiple tables within a . > [!NOTE] > 加载操作将因如果在传入的源数据列的任何`reader`是计算的列。The load operation will fail with an if any of the source data columns in the incoming `reader` are computed columns. `loadOption`参数，可指定要导入的数据与现有数据进行交互和可以是任何中的值的方式枚举。The `loadOption` parameter allows you to specify how you want the imported data to interact with existing data, and can be any of the values from the enumeration. 请参阅的文档有关使用此参数的详细信息的方法。See the documentation for the method for more information on using this parameter. `errorHandler`参数是委托，它指的是将数据加载过程中发生错误时调用的过程。The `errorHandler` parameter is a delegate that refers to a procedure that is called when an error occurs while loading data. 参数传递给该过程提供了可用于检索有关所发生的错误，数据的当前行的信息的属性和所填充。The parameter passed to the procedure provides properties that allow you to retrieve information about the error that occurred, the current row of data, and the being filled. 使用此委托机制，而不是更简单的 try/catch 块，可用于确定该错误，处理这种情况，并继续根据需要处理。Using this delegate mechanism, rather than a simpler try/catch block, allows you to determine the error, handle the situation, and continue processing if you like. 参数提供属性： 将此属性设置为`true`以指示已处理错误并且希望继续进行处理; 属性设置为`false`以指示你想要停止处理。The parameter supplies a property: set this property to `true` to indicate that you have handled the error and wish to continue processing; set the property to `false` to indicate that you wish to halt processing. 请注意，将该属性设置为`false`会导致触发要引发异常的问题的代码。Be aware that setting the property to `false` causes the code that triggered the problem to throw an exception. `tables`参数允许您指定的数组实例，指示每个结果集加载从读取器所对应的表的顺序。The `tables` parameter allows you to specify an array of instances, indicating the order of the tables corresponding to each result set loaded from the reader. 方法填充每个提供单个结果集，从源数据读取器中的数据的实例。The method fills each supplied instance with data from a single result set from the source data reader. 在每个结果集之后,方法会移到下一步中的结果集读取器，直到没有更多结果集。After each result set, the method moves on to the next result set within the reader, until there are no more result sets. 此方法的名称解析方案是与跟相同方法的类。The name resolution scheme for this method is the same as that followed by the method of the class. ## Examples 以下示例将添加到表，然后尝试使用方法从其加载数据，其中包含不兼容的架构。The following example adds a table to a , and then attempts to use the method to load data from a that contains an incompatible schema. 而不是捕获错误，此示例使用委托来调查和处理错误。Rather than trapping the error, this example uses a delegate to investigate and handle the error. 在控制台窗口中显示输出。The output is displayed in the console window. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于合并两个具有很大程度上类似的架构的对象。The method is used to merge two objects that have largely similar schemas. 合并通常用于在客户端应用程序上，若要从数据源的最新更改合并到现有。A merge is typically used on a client application to incorporate the latest changes from a data source into an existing . 这样，客户端应用程序能够刷新数据源的最新的数据。This allows the client application to have a refreshed with the latest data from the data source. 通常在一系列过程涉及验证更改、 协调错误、 所做的更改，使用更新数据源和最后刷新现有的末尾调用方法。The method is typically called at the end of a series of procedures that involve validating changes, reconciling errors, updating the data source with the changes, and finally refreshing the existing . 在客户端应用程序中，是常见的一个按钮，用户可以单击它来收集已更改的数据并将其发送回中间层组件之前对它进行验证。In a client application, it is common to have a single button that the user can click that gathers the changed data and validates it before sending it back to a middle-tier component. 在此方案中，第一次调用方法。In this scenario, the method is first invoked. 方法返回第二个优化为验证和合并。That method returns a second optimized for validating and merging. 在这一秒对象只包含并发生更改，从而导致原始的子集的对象。This second object contains only the and objects that were changed, resulting in a subset of the original . 此子集通常较小，因此可以更有效地传递回中间层组件。This subset is generally smaller and thus more efficiently passed back to a middle-tier component. 然后，中间层组件使用通过存储过程所做的更改更新原始数据源。The middle-tier component then updates the original data source with the changes through stored procedures. 然后，中间层可以发送回一个新（通过再次运行原始查询），包括原始数据和数据源中的最新数据或者它可以发送回包含从数据源对其进行任何更改的子集。The middle tier can then send back either a new that includes original data and the latest data from the data source (by running the original query again), or it can send back the subset with any changes that have been made to it from the data source. （例如，如果数据源自动创建唯一的主键值，这些值可以将传播回客户端应用程序。）在任一情况下，返回可以合并回客户端应用程序的原始与方法。(For example, if the data source automatically creates unique primary key values, these values can be propagated back to the client application.) In either case, the returned can be merged back into the client application's original with the method. 当调用方法时，两个架构对象进行比较，因为它是可能的架构可能已更改。When the method is called, the schemas of the two objects are compared because it is possible that the schemas may have been changed. 例如，在企业到企业方案中，新列可能具有已添加到 XML 架构的自动化过程。For example, in a business-to-business scenario, new columns may have been added to an XML schema by an automated process. 如果源包含架构元素 (添加对象) 缺少目标中，架构元素可以通过设置添加到目标`missingSchemaAction`参数`MissingSchemaAction.Add`。If the source contains schema elements (added objects) that are missing in the target, the schema elements can be added to the target by setting the `missingSchemaAction` argument to `MissingSchemaAction.Add`. 在这种情况下，合并包含添加的架构和数据。In that case, the merged contains the added schema and data. 合并后的架构，则数据将合并。After merging schemas, the data is merged. 合并新的源时到目标中时，任何源行与的值`Unchanged`， `Modified`，或`Deleted`与具有相同的主键值的目标行匹配。When merging a new source into the target, any source rows with a value of `Unchanged`, `Modified`, or `Deleted` are matched to target rows with the same primary key values. 源的行的值`Added`与同一个作为新的源行的主键值的新目标行匹配。Source rows with a value of `Added` are matched to new target rows with the same primary key values as the new source rows. 在合并期间将禁用约束。During a merge, constraints are disabled. 如果不能合并，结束时启用任何约束生成合并的数据都将保留而约束被禁用。If any constraints cannot be enabled at the end of a merge, a is generated and the merged data is retained while the constraints are disabled. 在这种情况下，属性设置为`false`，和中错误标记为无效的所有行。In this case, the property is set to `false`, and all rows that are invalid are marked in error. 尝试重置之前，必须解决这些错误属性设置为`true`。The errors must be resolved before attempting to reset the property to `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法用于合并两个具有很大程度上类似的架构的对象。The method is used to merge two objects that have largely similar schemas. 合并通常用于在客户端应用程序上，若要从数据源的最新更改合并到现有。A merge is typically used on a client application to incorporate the latest changes from a data source into an existing . 这样，客户端应用程序能够刷新数据源的最新的数据。This allows the client application to have a refreshed with the latest data from the data source. 通常在一系列过程涉及验证更改、 协调错误、 所做的更改，使用更新数据源和最后刷新现有的末尾调用方法。The method is typically called at the end of a series of procedures that involve validating changes, reconciling errors, updating the data source with the changes, and finally refreshing the existing . 在客户端应用程序中，是常见的一个按钮，用户可以单击它来收集已更改的数据并将其发送回中间层组件之前对它进行验证。In a client application, it is common to have a single button that the user can click that gathers the changed data and validates it before sending it back to a middle-tier component. 在此方案中，第一次调用方法。In this scenario, the method is first invoked. 方法返回第二个优化为验证和合并。That method returns a second optimized for validating and merging. 在这一秒对象只包含并发生更改，从而导致原始的子集的对象。This second object contains only the and objects that were changed, resulting in a subset of the original . 此子集是通常较小，因此详细信息有效地传递回中间层组件。This subset is generally smaller, and thus more efficiently passed back to a middle-tier component. 然后，中间层组件使用通过存储过程所做的更改更新原始数据源。The middle-tier component then updates the original data source with the changes through stored procedures. 然后，中间层可以发送回一个新（通过再次运行原始查询），包括原始数据和数据源中的最新数据或者它可以发送回包含从数据源对其进行任何更改的子集。The middle tier can then send back either a new that includes original data and the latest data from the data source (by running the original query again), or it can send back the subset with any changes that have been made to it from the data source. （例如，如果数据源自动创建唯一的主键值，这些值可以将传播回客户端应用程序。）在任一情况下，返回可以合并回客户端应用程序的原始与方法。(For example, if the data source automatically creates unique primary key values, these values can be propagated back to the client application.) In either case, the returned can be merged back into the client application's original with the method. 为了便于说明方法中，我们使用"目标"来表示当前，"源"以命名第二个 （参数） 和。To facilitate explanation of the method, we use "target" to signify the current , and "source" to name the second (parameter) . 目标如此命名是因为它是在其发生某项操作 （合并） 的对象。The target is so named because it is the object upon which an action (the merge) occurs. 第二个被称为"源"，因为它包含的信息不会更改，但已将其合并到当前。The second is called a "source" because the information it contains does not change, but instead is merged into the current . 当调用方法时，两个架构对象进行比较，因为它是可能的架构可能已更改。When the method is called, the schemas of the two objects are compared because it is possible that the schemas may have been changed. 例如，在企业到企业方案中，新列可能具有已添加到 XML 架构的自动化过程。For example, in a business-to-business scenario, new columns may have been added to an XML schema by an automated process. 如果源包含架构元素 (添加对象) 缺少目标中，架构元素可以通过设置添加到目标`missingSchemaAction`参数`MissingSchemaAction.Add`。If the source contains schema elements (added objects) that are missing in the target, the schema elements can be added to the target by setting the `missingSchemaAction` argument to `MissingSchemaAction.Add`. 在这种情况下，合并包含添加的架构和数据。In that case, the merged contains the added schema and data. 合并后的架构，则数据将合并。After merging schemas, the data is merged. 合并新的源时到目标中时，任何源行与的值`Unchanged`， `Modified`，或`Deleted`与具有相同的主键值的目标行匹配。When merging a new source into the target, any source rows with a value of `Unchanged`, `Modified`, or `Deleted` are matched to target rows with the same primary key values. 源的行`DataRowState`的值`Added`与同一个作为新的源行的主键值的新目标行匹配。Source rows with a `DataRowState` value of `Added` are matched to new target rows with the same primary key values as the new source rows. 在合并期间将禁用约束。During a merge, constraints are disabled. 如果不能合并，结束时启用任何约束生成合并的数据都将保留而约束被禁用。If any constraints cannot be enabled at the end of merge, a is generated and the merged data is retained while the constraints are disabled. 在这种情况下，属性设置为`false`，和中错误标记为无效的所有行。In this case, the property is set to `false`, and all rows that are invalid are marked in error. 尝试重置之前，必须解决这些错误属性设置为`true`。The errors must be resolved before attempting to reset the property to `true`.

XML 文档的命名空间用于确定范围的 XML 属性和元素时读取到。The namespace of an XML document is used to scope XML attributes and elements when read into a . 例如，如果包含架构命名空间"myCompany，"文档中读取的和尝试读取数据只能从具有不同的命名空间的文档，则忽略与现有架构不对应的任何数据。For example, if a contains a schema that was read from a document with the namespace "myCompany," and an attempt is made to read data only from a document with a different namespace, any data that does not correspond to the existing schema is ignored. ## Examples 下面的示例设置之前调用方法。The following example sets the before calling the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法提供方法来读取只将数据或数据和架构读入从 XML 文档，而方法读取仅架构。The method provides a way to read either data only, or both data and schema into a from an XML document, whereas the method reads only the schema. 若要读取数据和架构，使用之一`ReadXML`包括的重载`mode`参数，并将其值设置为`ReadSchema`。To read both data and schema, use one of the `ReadXML` overloads that includes the `mode` parameter, and set its value to `ReadSchema`. 请注意，同样适用于和方法，分别。Note that the same is true for the and methods, respectively. 若要写入 XML 数据或架构和数据从`DataSet`，使用`WriteXml`方法。To write XML data, or both schema and data from the `DataSet`, use the `WriteXml` method. 若要编写只为架构，使用`WriteXmlSchema`方法。To write just the schema, use the `WriteXmlSchema` method. > [!NOTE] > 如果中的列类型，将引发`DataRow`正在读取或写入到实现并不实现。An will be thrown if a column type in the `DataRow` being read from or written to implements and does not implement . 如果指定内联架构，则内联架构用于扩展现有的关系结构之前加载数据。If an in-line schema is specified, the in-line schema is used to extend the existing relational structure prior to loading the data. 如果不存在任何冲突 （例如，具有不同数据类型定义的同一表中的同一列） 被引发异常。If there are any conflicts (for example, the same column in the same table defined with different data types) an exception is raised. 如果指定没有行中的架构，则关系的结构推断，必要时，通过扩展根据 XML 文档的结构。If no in-line schema is specified, the relational structure is extended through inference, as necessary, according to the structure of the XML document. 如果不能通过推断扩展架构，以便公开的所有数据，将引发异常。If the schema cannot be extended through inference in order to expose all data, an exception is raised. > [!NOTE] > `DataSet`不会将一个 XML 元素关联与其对应`DataColumn`或`DataTable`合法 XML 字符，如 ("_") 在序列化的 XML 中的转义时。The `DataSet` does not associate an XML element with its corresponding `DataColumn` or `DataTable` when legal XML characters like ("_") are escaped in the serialized XML. `DataSet`本身仅对 XML 元素名称中的非法 XML 字符进行转义，因此只能使用相同。The `DataSet` itself only escapes illegal XML characters in XML element names and hence can only consume the same. 当 XML 元素名称中的合法字符进行转义时，处理时将忽略该元素。When legal characters in XML element name are escaped, the element is ignored while processing. 如果 XML 架构包括`targetNamespace`，可能无法读取数据，并调用时，可能会发生异常加载含 XML 中包含非限定命名空间的元素。If the XML Schema for a includes `targetNamespace`, data may not be read, and you may encounter exceptions when calling to load the with XML that contains elements with no qualifying namespace. 若要读取未限定的元素，设置`elementFormDefault`等于"qualified"中的 XML 架构，如以下示例所示。To read unqualified elements, set `elementFormDefault` equal to "qualified" in your XML Schema, as the following example demonstrates. ``` ``` > [!NOTE] > 如果为架构你包含元素的名称相同，但不同类型，请在相同的命名空间，尝试将架构读入时引发异常与通过指定`XmlReadMode.ReadSchema`。If the schema for your contains elements of the same name, but different type, in the same namespace, an exception is thrown when you attempt to read the schema into the with by specifying `XmlReadMode.ReadSchema`. 如果您使用的.NET Framework 1.0 版，则此异常不会发生。This exception does not occur if you are using .NET Framework version 1.0. ## Examples 下面的示例首先创建一个简单与一个，两个列和 10 个行。The following example first creates a simple with one , two columns, and ten rows. 架构和数据写入磁盘后通过调用方法。The schema and data are written to disk by invoking the method. 第二个创建和方法用于使用架构和数据填充它。A second is created and the method is used to fill it with schema and data. [!code-csharp[Classic WebData DataSet.ReadXml1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataSet.ReadXml1 Example/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Classic WebData DataSet.ReadXml1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_ADO.NET/Classic WebData DataSet.ReadXml1 Example/VB/source.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用来调用方法对所有包含的对象。Invoke the to call the method on all objects contained by the . 包含的对象可以每个设置置于编辑模式下通过调用方法。 objects contained by the can each be set into edit mode by invoking the method. 之后调用方法，可以通过调用拒绝更改上到对象属于。After invoking the method, changes can be rejected by calling the on the to which the objects belong. 当方法调用时，任何仍处于编辑模式的行取消其编辑内容。When the method is called, any rows still in edit-mode cancel their edits. 新行并删除。New rows are removed. 已修改和删除的行返回到其原始状态 (`DataRowState.Unchanged`)。Modified and deleted rows return back to their original state (`DataRowState.Unchanged`). AcceptChanges 和 RejectChanges 仅适用于相关的更改 (即`Add`， `Remove`， `Delete`，和`Modify`)。AcceptChanges and RejectChanges only apply to related changes (that is, `Add`, `Remove`, `Delete`, and `Modify`). 它们不是适用于架构或结构上的更改。They are not applicable to schema or structural changes. ## Examples 下面的示例演示派生自的类类。The following example shows a class derived from the class. 从函数内调用事件。The event is invoked from within a function. remarks.format: ## Remarks 一个将其架构和实例数据在 Web 服务和远程处理方案中默认情况下序列化。A serializes its schema and instance data by default in Web services and remoting scenarios. 设置属性的类型化`DataSet`到导致要从序列化有效负载中排除架构信息。Setting the property of a typed `DataSet` to causes schema information to be excluded from the serialization payload. 支持的类型化`DataSet`。 is supported only for a typed `DataSet`. 对于非类型化`DataSet`此属性只能设置为。For an un-typed `DataSet` this property can only be set to . 只应在其中键入的基础架构信息的情况下`DataTables`，`DataRelations`和`Constraints`尚未修改。 should only be used in cases where the schema information of the underlying typed `DataTables`, `DataRelations` and `Constraints` has not been modified. 如果修改已发生的、 完整的架构信息应序列化与。If modifications have occurred, complete schema information should be serialized with . 版本 2.0 或更高版本的.NET Framework 支持。 is supported in version 2.0 of the .NET Framework or later. 当设置，则只有顶级运行时属性上存在进行序列化。When is set, only the top level runtime properties present on the are serialized. 此外，这些扩展会序列仅当发生使其不同于默认值。In addition, they are serialized only if they happen to be different from the default values. 没有任何`Tables`，`Relations`或`Constraints`进行序列化。None of the `Tables`, `Relations` or `Constraints` are serialized. 序列化的运行时属性包括， ， ， ， ，并。The serialized runtime properties include , , , , , and . 这些属性进行序列化，以确保会保留整体运行时数据完整性。These properties are serialized to make sure that overall runtime data integrity is preserved.
